page.title: 15VISIT TO STOKE POGES GOLF C.
page.content: This was founded in 1909. The club house was built by John Penn, second son of William Penn in 1774. Our questions about the club house were answered by Mr. P. Lunn, the caretaker. It has about fifty rooms and is a listed building. The club house has many works of art including an Adam fireplace and sculpture featured in Country Life magazine. The course is 6642 yards long and measures 198 acres. The longest holes are the first and thirteenth which both measure 502 yards. The course record for eighteen holes is 65. The club has about 700 members and the course is looked after by five people. In the professional's shop iron clubs start at Â£15.95 and can be as much as Â£65. Woods start at Â£19.95 and can be as much as Â£149.
